intro: Scaligeria tournefortii, commonly known as the Canary Island scaleria, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to the arid climate of its native habitat. It is often found in coastal areas and is known for its resilience to drought and salt spray. The species is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
